nodes.bodyText:
I don't think it's safe to write all of the params as a JSON object, as that could contain the user password and other sensitive information.
We should be much more precise about what goes into workUnit. So we should have a method of e.g. "ObjectNode buildWorkUnitFromParams(Map)" that builds an ObjectNode based on the params we know may exist in the Map, and nothing more than that.

See my comment to @anu3990  about an Options class that will simplify writing tests, as opposed to building a Map. We will likely have many tests that populate different sets of options. The Options class will handle that for us.
No need for xdmp.log here, the stacktrace from the fn.error will be visible in the logs
Use ds-utils.sjs - that has helper functions in it to simplify this - e.g. throwBadRequest would be appropriate here.
Use hub-utils.parsePermissions

We only want to add a source object if at least one of these is set. So you should add a test that verifies that when neither sourcename nor sourcetype is provided, then the sources array does not exist.

We need a test verifying that it's okay if permissions is not, then the documents will be added with no permissions. You'll need to use "runAsAdmin" after ingesting the data to verify that the documents exist.
We can't force Ernie to specify permissions, he's free to insert documents without any permissions.
uriprefix should go into buildWorkUnitFromParams. Also, I'd just call that "buildDefaultWorkUnit" - it's clear that it's built from params because that's the sole argument.
Added uriprefix to buildDefaultWorkUnit
Updated the changes
Put "Test" as a suffix on this class name, that's our convention for every test class.
Renamed the class

The endpoint should do this, not the connector. The endpoint should say - if uriprefix is in the workUnit, then I'll use that, even if it's null. It's up to the client to pass in the correct value for uriprefix - if the client passes in "uriprefix": null, then the endpoint says - Well I guess you want null as the prefix, so I'll use that.
Made the changes
This test should verify that two collections work, so e.g. "fruits,stuff".
Addressed via https://github.com/SameeraPriyathamTadikonda/marklogic-data-hub/pull/25/files
Same https://github.com/SameeraPriyathamTadikonda/marklogic-data-hub/pull/25/files
There's a lot of duplication across these 4 tests - I'm going to submit a PR to yours to resolve that.
See https://github.com/SameeraPriyathamTadikonda/marklogic-data-hub/pull/25/files

"const" is preferable to "let", as it makes it clear that the value will not be changing. So do this instead:
const collections = work.collections != null ? work.collections.split(',') : [];
Made the changes
Same thing here - can adapt this to use "const" instead of "let".

Pinging @rahulvudutala  and @fsnow  and @ryanjdew  about this - this is the property name we're proposing for capturing the source type. Note that this is going on the develop branch. Nothing in DHF will care about it yet though.
